Use this data source to access information about existing Images within a Resource Group.


{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}

{{% example csharp %}}
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Azure = Pulumi.Azure;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var example = Output.Create(Azure.Compute.GetImages.InvokeAsync(new Azure.Compute.GetImagesArgs
        {
            ResourceGroupName = "example-resources",
        }));
    }

}
```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example go %}}
```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/sdk/v3/go/azure/compute"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v2/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := compute.GetImages(ctx, &compute.GetImagesArgs{
			ResourceGroupName: "example-resources",
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

            title="Required">
        <span id="osstate_nodejs">

</span> 
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/string">string</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}the State of the OS used in the Image.
{{% /md %}}</dd>

    <dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">

    </dt>

{{% /md %}}</dd>

    </dt>

{{% /md %}}</dd>

</dl>
